p: The weighted centroid of the wintering population in January shifted by 83 km (=2.60 km/year) in a NNE direction between 1983 (45°881N/2°213E) and 2015 (46°609N/2°466E), with a significant linear change between latitude and years (latitude N = 0.01414*year + 18.06, p < 0.0036, R 2 = 55.3%), despite an abnormal decrease of the latitude in 2013 (Figure 6). There was a strong correlation between the latitudinal weighted centroid and the number of wintering cormorants in January, 2013 excluded (Spearman r = 0.811 p < 0.007). However, when 2013 was included, it was not valid any more (Spearman r = 0.544, p < 0.06).
